item.title: Compiler Enforced Semantic Unit Types
item.description: Computations of physical values in programming languages can quickly get out of hand due to the complex units that the programmer has to keep track of. Good variable naming and comments can help, but nothing is stopping double run_time_sec from storing a time measured in milliseconds. Furthermore, different functions might use the same value, but measured in different units, requiring manual conversions. Overall, it’s just an unpleasant burden placed on the programmer and a cause of many errors.
